vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-eth
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function withdrawBalance() public {
        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // Check if the user is already withdrawing their balance
        locked[msg.sender] = true; // Lock the user's account to prevent reentrancy
        uint amountToWithdraw = userBalances[msg.sender];
        userBalances[msg.sender] = 0; // Update the user's balance before sending ether to prevent reentrancy
        require(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)("")); // Send ether to the user
        locked[msg.sender] = false; // Unlock the user's account after the ether has been sent
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Reentrancy_secure.withdrawBalance (patch_7.sol#8-15):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)()) (patch_7.sol#13)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- locked (patch_7.sol#14)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function withdrawBalance() public {
        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // Check if the user is already withdrawing their balance
        locked[msg.sender] = true; // Lock the user's account to prevent reentrancy
        uint amountToWithdraw = userBalances[msg.sender];
        userBalances[msg.sender] = 0; // Update the user's balance before sending ether to prevent reentrancy
        require(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)("")); // Send ether to the user
        locked[msg.sender] = false; // Unlock the user's account after the ether has been sent

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_7.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.0 (patch_7.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function withdrawBalance() public {
        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // Check if the user is already withdrawing their balance
        locked[msg.sender] = true; // Lock the user's account to prevent reentrancy
        uint amountToWithdraw = userBalances[msg.sender];
        userBalances[msg.sender] = 0; // Update the user's balance before sending ether to prevent reentrancy
        require(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)("")); // Send ether to the user
        locked[msg.sender] = false; // Unlock the user's account after the ether has been sent
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Reentrancy_secure.withdrawBalance (patch_7.sol#8-15):
	-require(bool)(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)()) patch_7.sol#13

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
